def_en: The cause of an event, usually a bad event, is the thing that makes it happen.
To cause something, usually something bad, means to make it happen.
If you have cause for a particular feeling or action, you have good reasons for feeling it or doing it.
lost cause; A cause is an aim or principle which a group of people supports or is fighting for.
You use cause and effect to talk about the way in which one thing is caused by another.

def_cn: (为了特定目的)与…联手，与…配合
def_en: If one group of people makes common cause with another, they act together in order to achieve a particular aim even though their aims and beliefs are normally very different.

def_cn: 为了公益事业;为了行善
def_en: If you say that something is in a good cause or for a good cause, you mean that it is worth doing or giving to because it will help other people, for example by raising money for charity.
